title: J05-4003

sentences.text: We present a novel method for discovering parallel sentences in comparable , non-parallel corpora .
We train a maximum entropy classifier that , given a pair of sentences , can reliably determine whether or not they are translations of each other .
Using this approach , we extract parallel data from large Chinese , Arabic , and English non-parallel newspaper corpora .
We evaluate the quality of the extracted data by showing that it improves the performance of a state-of-the-art statistical machine translation system .
We also show that a good-quality MT system can be built from scratch by starting with a very small parallel corpus -LRB- 100,000 words -RRB- and exploiting a large non-parallel corpus .
Thus , our method can be applied with great benefit to language pairs for which only scarce resources are available .

Entity-our_method.label: our method
Entity-our_method.description: A novel approach for discovering parallel sentences in comparable and non-parallel corpora by training a maximum entropy classifier that determines whether two given sentences are translations of each other.

summary: We present a novel method for discovering parallel sentences in comparable , non-parallel corpora . We train a maximum entropy classifier that , given a pair of sentences , can reliably determine whether or not they are translations of each other . Using this approach , we extract parallel data from large Chinese , Arabic , and English non-parallel newspaper corpora . We evaluate the quality of the extracted data by showing that it improves the performance of a state-of-the-art statistical machine translation system . We also show that a good-quality MT system can be built from scratch by starting with a very small parallel corpus -LRB- 100,000 words -RRB- and exploiting a large non-parallel corpus . Thus , our method can be applied with great benefit to language pairs for which only scarce resources are available .

Predicate-train.label: train
Predicate-train.description: To engage or utilize something (typically an entity or process) for learning, development, or improvement. The predicate 'train' indicates that the subject is actively using or applying the object to acquire new skills, knowledge, or abilities.

Predicate-can_reliably_determine.label: can reliably determine
Predicate-can_reliably_determine.description: The predicate 'can reliably determine' indicates that the subject has a high degree of accuracy and consistency in making judgments about the object, resulting in reliable conclusions or decisions.

Predicate-extracts.label: extracts
Predicate-extracts.description: The predicate 'extracts' indicates a process of obtaining or selecting specific information from a larger dataset or source. It implies that the subject (approach, method, etc.) yields or produces the object (data, insights, etc.), which has been extracted or isolated in some way.

Predicate-evaluate_the_quality_of.label: evaluate the quality of
Predicate-evaluate_the_quality_of.description: To 'evaluate the quality of' means to assess or judge the degree of excellence, accuracy, effectiveness, or other relevant characteristics that define the object. The subject performs this evaluation by examining and analyzing various aspects of the object's properties, features, or performance, with the goal of determining its overall value, merit, or fitness for a particular purpose.

Predicate-show_that.label: show that
Predicate-show_that.description: To demonstrate or prove the existence of something (typically an idea, concept, or quality), often through evidence, examples, or demonstration.

Predicate-exploiting.label: exploiting
Predicate-exploiting.description: The predicate 'exploiting' indicates that the subject is making use of or taking advantage of the object to achieve some goal or benefit. It implies a relationship where the subject derives value, insight, or improvement from the object.

Predicate-can_be_applied_with_great_bene.label: can be applied with great benefit to
Predicate-can_be_applied_with_great_bene.description: This predicate indicates that the subject has a positive impact or outcome when used or implemented for the purpose of benefiting the object. It suggests a causal relationship between the subject and the object, implying that the subject's application leads to a desirable consequence.

Predicate-improve_the_performance_of.label: improve the performance of
Predicate-improve_the_performance_of.description: To enhance or optimize the functioning or effectiveness of something to achieve better results or outcomes.

Predicate-use.label: use
Predicate-use.description: To employ or utilize something for a specific purpose or function. The predicate 'use' indicates that the subject (agent or entity) applies its capabilities to achieve an outcome, manipulate resources, or exploit opportunities as represented by the object.

Predicate-present.label: present
Predicate-present.description: Indicates that a particular concept or idea is being introduced, demonstrated, or shared. The predicate 'present' connects the subject (the novel method) to the object (our method), suggesting that our method is being presented as an innovative approach for discovering parallel sentences in comparable corpora.

Predicate-can_reliably_determine_whether.label: can reliably determine whether or not they are translations of each other
Predicate-can_reliably_determine_whether.description: This predicate indicates that the subject has the ability to accurately identify and distinguish between pairs of texts (or sentences) based on their linguistic similarity or equivalence. In other words, it suggests that the subject can analyze two pieces of text and determine whether they are translations of each other, taking into account factors such as language, style, tone, and content.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is related to or encompasses the object through a hierarchical relationship. In general, it suggests that the subject has a more comprehensive or inclusive concept than the object.
